com.poesys.bs.delegate
Class AbstractDelegate

java.lang.Object
  com.poesys.bs.delegate.AbstractDelegate

public class AbstractDelegate
extends java.lang.Object

An abstract base class for the business delegates in the application. The class provides standard database connection services using the IConnectionFactory service locator.

The Business Delegate provides an abstraction for the business services in a particular subsystem. The implementation of the business delegate must either contain the business logic or must delegate the request to another layer, such as EJB session beans. The main goal of the business delegate is to abstract the service locator and business logic for the business layer.

The implementation of the AbstractDelegate class should add methods for all the required services. Such methods should use business-layer data transfer objects (DTOs) to move data in and out of the system. These DTOs provide object data and services to the user interface layer and are thus different from the DTOs in the data access layer. The business delegate will often get data using data-access-layer DTOs and will transform these DTOs into the business layer DTOs (which may actually wrap a data-access DTO as its internal implementation).

Note: You should log exceptions at the top of the calling hierarchy in the user interface layer that uses these business delegates, not in the business delegate itself. The error messages defined in business delegates should be message strings installed in a resource bundle for internationalization. Your business delegate class should throw only a DelegateException that nests the causing exception, if any.

Author:
Robert J. Muller
See Also:
DelegateException

rollBack

protected void rollBack(java.sql.Connection connection,
                        java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.Throwable e)
                 throws DelegateException
Roll back a transaction, then throw a delegate exception that encapsulates the excpetion that caused the rollback.

Parameters:
connection - the open connection to roll back
key - the bundle key for the error message
e - the exception that resulted in the rollback
Throws:
DelegateException - always, either with the passed exception encapsulated or with a rollback-problem exception, if there was a problem rolling back
